verses.roman:
'keśī' snāna kari' sei 'kālīya-daha' yāite
āmli-talāya gosāñire dekhe ācambite

synonyms: keśī snāna kari'-after taking his bath at the place known as Keśī-tīrtha; sei—that person; kālīya-daha yāite—going to the Kālīya-daha; āmli-talāya—at the place known as Āmli-talā; gosāñire—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; dekhe—sees; ācambite—suddenly.
translation: After bathing at Keśī-tīrtha, Kṛṣṇadāsa went toward Kālīya-daha and suddenly saw Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu sitting at Āmli-talā [Teṅtulī-talā].
